docs.abstract: Stuart Elliott Advertising column notes that advertisements for Super Bowl XLVII will be heavy on colas, beers and cars; six automakers are expected to advertise eight car brands during game, while six other companies are to advertise eight beverages.

docs.snippet: While some inside the network were pushing to publish an article about the girlfriend hoax and others were pushing back, another outlet broke the story....
docs.lead_paragraph: While some inside the network were pushing to publish an article about the girlfriend hoax and others were pushing back, another outlet broke the story.
docs.abstract: Fierce debate raged inside ESPN over publishing article about how Notre Dame linebacker Manti Te'o's girlfriend might be a hoax, as sports Web site Deadspin reported story; network was hoping for an on-camera interview with Te'o.

headline.seo: As ESPN Debated, Te’o Story Slipped Away
headline.main: As ESPN Debated, Manti Te’o Story Slipped Away
headline.print_headline:
While ESPN
Debated Itself,
The Te’o Story
Slipped Away

docs.snippet: WHITE--Donald "Danny" E., of the Bronx, passed away peacefully on January 15, 2013. He was born in New York City to Jeremiaha and Marguerite (Shea) White on February 12, 1933 . In 1955 he married Mary Kelliher in New York City. Danny was a Gaelic ...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHITE--Donald "Danny" E., of the Bronx, passed away peacefully on January 15, 2013. He was born in New York City to Jeremiaha and Marguerite (Shea) White on February 12, 1933 . In 1955 he married Mary Kelliher in New York City. Danny was a Gaelic football player for County Kerry - a US team, a member of Kerryman's Association, he played with the County Tyrone Band and later formed the Kerry Pipe Band in 1973. He was a plant manager with The New York Times in Carlstadt, NJ for over 33 years until his retirement in 1987. His son Michael is a Handler for the Daily News. He was the beloved husband to Mary, and dear father to Donald, Maureen and Michael White. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to ASPCA 424 E. 92nd St., NY, NY 10128 www.aspca.org

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  WHITE, DONALD E.

docs.lead_paragraph: Four not-so-trendy people have come up with CouchCachet, an online remedy for people hit by an attack of FOMO, “Fear of Missing Out.”
docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on mobile app CouchCachet that finds coolest places in your neighborhood, then automatically uses Foursquare to check you into them; notes app addresses age-old 'fear of missing out' without any of the irritation of actually leaving the couch.

headline.seo: CouchCachet App Gives New Meaning to Lying on the Couch
headline.main: Don’t Get Up. App Makes Your Couch a Cool Spot.
headline.print_headline: Don’t Get Up. App Makes Your Couch A Cool Spot.
